 OOME: GC overhead limit exceeded
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=HjgUuc0e-yVZg2wxJojyjysQCxtHltfe42-Ki6M4Djnd
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

One note of clarification:

nfoscarini wrote:
> You can make Heritrix run out of memory by using just 1 seed by
> allowing it to hop endlessly around the internet.

This isn't true; in the default configurations, and other wise 
configurations, a crawl that's free to go 'anywhere' may fill your disks 
or begin to run very, very slowly (as lookup structures become 
inefficiently large and disk-dependent), but it should *not* run out of 
memory (RAM) triggering an OutOfMemoryException (OOME).

If it does, either there's a configuration issue or a bug.

- Gordon @ IA
